text.tspan: According to this research, migrants are generally more reluctant to take the
COVID-19 vaccine. They express fear of side effects and concerns over safety. In
Colombia, for instance, where more than half of the surveyed populations are
currently migrants from Venezuela, the level of confidence in the COVID-19
vaccine is low and the fear of vaccines being unsafe is one of the most reported
Though 80% of the participants in the survey say that they would agree or have
agreed to take the COVID-19 vaccine, their trust in the vaccine differs with only
24% of respondents having high trust in the vaccine and 64% having little to
In Panama, for instance, qualitative data from an assessment on migrants on
the move in El Darien, revealed that the reason behind not getting vaccinated is
mainly because they donâ€™t want to experience side effects during their journey
Trust and willingness to take the vaccine are not necessarily related
